title: Fix Meditation page timer controls and alignment regression

requirements.text: On the Meditation page (the pre-meditation flow at route "/pre-meditation"), replace the unexpected timer control buttons with a time range input UI (as it previously existed) so the user can set the session duration via input fields instead of those buttons.

quotes: In meditation page, they should be replaced with input time range. Like previously it was.

acceptanceCriteria: In the "/pre-meditation" page, the timer duration can be set using a time range input UI (two inputs for start/end or equivalent range selector), not via the current unexpected buttons.
No extra/unintended control buttons are shown where the time range input is expected.

requirements.text: Center-align the meditation timer display on the Meditation page so the timer (ring + time text) is visually centered horizontally (and not slightly left) across common viewport sizes.

quotes: Adjust timer to be in center position, because it is slightly to the left in meditation page.

acceptanceCriteria: On the active meditation view in "/pre-meditation", the timer ring and time readout are centered within the page container (visually aligned with the page’s horizontal center).
Center alignment remains correct on mobile and desktop breakpoints.

requirements.text: Limit changes to only what is necessary to restore the Meditation page’s previous duration input behavior and fix timer centering; avoid unrelated UI/behavior changes elsewhere in the app.

quotes: I don't understand why you keep changing things I didn't request?

acceptanceCriteria: No unrelated UI changes are introduced outside the Meditation page as part of this fix.
Existing meditation session flow (start, pause/resume, completion -> reflection/save) continues to work after the UI regression fix.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep backend architecture as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce new backend services.
nonGoals: Redesigning the overall Meditation experience beyond restoring the time range input and fixing centering.
Adding new meditation types, new audio content, or new backend persistence features.
